The CRA released a policy statement on charitable status applications from organizations working with ethnocultural communities, outlining which activities will be deemed charitable. The section also provides a link to the CRA Policy Statement on "Charitable Work and Ethnocultural Groups: Information on registering as a charity".
metadata.next_section_summary: The section discusses the winding down of the Political Activities Audit and its implications for charities. It also mentions the Canadian government's consultation on political activities in 2016, where organizations provided feedback on advocacy rules and their impact on charities. The section emphasizes that the information provided is general and not legal advice, and encourages consulting a lawyer for professional assurance. It also mentions that COCo can provide a list of lawyers with experience working with community groups.
